column1: Hinesville is a city in Liberty County

column1: Hinesville was founded in 1838. That same year
column2: the seat of Liberty County was transferred to Hinesville from Riceboro. It was incorporated as a city in 1916. The city is named for Charleton Hines
column3: a state senator.A 2017 report by Business Insider listed Hinesville as the most boring city in Georgia
column4: noting that there were only 25 full-service restaurants
column7: and 0 museums in the Hinesville metropolitan area.

column1: Hinesville is located west of the center of Liberty County
column2: on the south side of Fort Stewart
column3: the largest U.S. Army installation by area in the eastern United States. The city is bordered to the east by Flemington and to the south by Allenhurst and Walthourville. To the southwest the city limits extend to the Long County line.

column1: U.S. Route 84 passes through the city
column2: leading east 15 miles (24 km) to Interstate 95 near Midway and southwest 14 miles (23 km) to U.S. Route 301 at Ludowici. Hinesville is the second largest city on US 84 in Georgia after Valdosta. Savannah is 39 miles (63 km) northeast of Hinesville
column3: and Brunswick is 55 miles (89 km) to the south.

column7: part of the Canoochee River watershed flowing east to the tidal Ogeechee River.

column1: The U.S. Postal Service operates the Hinesville Post Office. The Liberty County Courthouse is in Hinesville and is listed on the National Register of Historic Places.
